about.hero_subtitle: The story of a board game shop that started with a love for gaming
about.story_subtitle: From a Small Shop to Thailand's Largest Board Game Community

story_content.para1: Our story began with a small shop called "Tang Gradan" in Platform Shopping Center Wong Wian Yai. This small shop had only 3 tables accommodating just 16 customers, but was filled with warm atmosphere and intended to be like a "friend's living room" where everyone knew each other well, chatted casually, and had fun together.
story_content.para2: Soon, the students and early customers who used our services became friends, became family, and became a small community that grew rapidly until our small shop could no longer accommodate everyone.
story_content.para3: We decided to expand to Seacon Bangkae mall and changed our name to NK Board Game. This became our new home that was warmer than before, with space to accommodate larger groups of players.
story_content.para4: With the kindness and support from Seacon's management, NK Board Game grew rapidly and became Thailand's largest board game shop, with activities and spaces that accommodate all genders, ages, and friend groups who want to have fun together.
story_content.para5: Today, NK Board Game is not just at Seacon Bangkae branch, but we have also expanded to Seacon Square Srinakarin and Samyan Mitrtown, making it easier for everyone to access the world of board games and have opportunities to meet new friends and get to know the lovely NK family.

hero.title: üèÜ Beyblade X Tournament Rules
hero.description: Official tournament regulations for Beyblade X at NK Board Game

items.definition: A Bey (often referred to as "a Beyblade") is the spinning top used to battle.
items.requirement: Each blader needs at least one complete Bey to battle.
items.components: A complete Bey consists of a blade, ratchet, and bit.
items.cx_system: For CX system blades, the blade must contain all three parts: a lock chip, main blade, and assist blade.

items.definition: A deck is a set of 3 Beys that is required for certain match types.
items.unique_parts: Only one copy of each part (except for lock chips) may be used per deck.
items.same_name: Parts are considered the same part when they share the same name.
items.regional: Regional variations in a name (such as Phoenix Wing / Soar Phoenix) are considered the same name.
items.derivative: Derivative designs ‚Äî such as Roar Tyranno's design being derived from Soar Phoenix ‚Äî are unique parts with unique names.
items.jurassic: Mosasaurus (TriceraSpiky), Spinosaurus (TyrannoRoar), Quetzalcoatlus (PteraSwing), and T. Rex (TyrannoBeat) are recolored Jurassic World Versions with alternate names. They are not considered to be different parts, and only one copy may be used.
items.lightning: Lightning L-Drago (upper type) and Lightning L-Drago (rapid-hit type) are both considered to be named Lightning L-Drago.
items.lock_chip: Lock chips with the same name can be used multiple times within a deck.
items.valkyrie: However, only one copy of the Valkyrie metal lock chip can be used within a deck.
items.no_swap: Parts cannot be exchanged between Beys within a deck at any point during a match.

items.definition: The launcher is used to launch the Bey into the stadium for battle.
items.string: String launchers, which are powered by an internal string mechanism.
items.winder: Winder launchers, which are powered by an external winder.
items.accessories: Any accessories attached to the launcher are considered part of the launcher.

items.definition: Battles take place in the stadium.
items.components: The stadium is comprised of a stadium cover and stadium body.
items.cover: The stadium cover includes the launch area, a circular opening through which Beys are launched.
items.body: The stadium body is the surface Beys are launched onto.
items.zones: The space inside the stadium is divided into three types of zones:
items.battle_zone: Battle Zone ‚Äì the entire space inside the stadium except for the over zone and Xtreme zone
items.over_zone: Over Zone ‚Äì two zones located at the left and right corners, at the front of the stadium
items.xtreme_zone: Xtreme Zone ‚Äì located in the center, at the front of the stadium
items.zone_entry: A Bey is considered to have entered a zone the moment it is mostly within that zone.

items.official_play: In a tournament setting, games of Beyblade are played in matches.
items.match_structure: A Beyblade match consists of battles, points and sets.
items.battle: Battles: When two Beys are played against each other and a winning Bey is determined once, resulting in points being awarded.
items.point: Points: Awarded to the winner of the battle. The number of points awarded is based on how the battle was won (see: scoring finishes).
items.set: Sets: Won when a blader has earned the required number of points.
items.points_to_win: The points required to win a set may be 4, 5, or 7 depending on the tournament's rules.
items.first_stage: 4 points is the default for the first stage of the tournament.
items.final_stage: 7 points is the default for the final stage of the tournament.
items.sets_to_win: The number of sets required to win the match depending on the match format:

xtreme.name: Xtreme Finish
xtreme.description: Initiated when the opposing Bey enters the Xtreme zone and becomes out-of-play.

over.name: Over Finish
over.description: Initiated when the opposing Bey enters the over zone and becomes out-of-play.

burst.name: Burst Finish
burst.description: Initiated and scored when the opposing Bey bursts.

spin.name: Spin Finish
spin.description: Initiated and scored when the opposing Bey stops spinning.

items.official_only: Only official Beyblade X products produced by Takara Tomy and Hasbro may be used.
items.no_broken: Cracked or broken equipment including Bey parts, launchers and stadiums may not be used.
items.no_modification: Any modification of equipment beyond what is explicitly allowed in these regulations is forbidden.
items.decoration: Parts may be decorated with paint and stickers if it doesn't affect performance.
items.wear: Parts that have been worn down outside of normal play cannot be used.
items.rubber: Rubber parts that wear normally can be used, judge decides.

banned.title: Banned Parts
banned.metal_needle: Metal Needle (MN) is banned from competition
banned.reason: Reason: This bit frequently damages stadiums with its pointed metal tip.

optional.title: üõ†Ô∏è Optional Rules
optional.description: Optional rules can be used by tournament organizers to create unique gameplay experiences and tailor events to their local Beyblade communities.

own_finish.title: 1. Own Finish
own_finish.description: When you score an Xtreme finish or over finish against a Bey that did not touch your Bey during the battle, it is considered an own finish instead.

locked_bey.title: 2. Locked Bey List
locked_bey.description: Before the start of each stage of the tournament, you must submit a Bey list to the tournament organizer.

out_spin.title: 3. Out-of-Bounds Spin Finish
out_spin.description: If the opposing Bey leaves the battle area through the launch area and becomes out-of-play, instead of voiding the battle, it will be considered as scoring a spin finish.

out_over.title: 4. Out-of-Bounds Over Finish
out_over.description: If the opposing Bey leaves the battle area through the launch area and becomes out-of-play, instead of voiding the battle, it will be considered as scoring an over finish.

swap_positions.title: 5. Swap Positions After Battle
swap_positions.description: After each battle within a set, the bladers swap launch positions.

loser_selects.title: 6. Loser Selects Position After Battle
loser_selects.description: After each battle within a set, the loser of the previous battle chooses their launch position.

no_disassembled.title: 7. No Disassembled Components
no_disassembled.description: Parts that have been disassembled in a way not intended by the manufacturer (e.g. removing screws or separating ratchets) cannot be used.

no_painted.title: 8. No Painted Parts
no_painted.description: Parts cannot be painted or coated. Small markings in the designated areas are still permitted.

mn_unbanned.title: 9. MN Bit Unbanned
mn_unbanned.description: The MN (Metal Needle) bit may be used.

adjust_before.title: 10. Adjust Before Presenting (WBO deck only)
adjust_before.description: Beys must be adjusted before being presented to the opponent, and cannot be adjusted after.

items.authority: At the discretion of the tournament organizer and judge(s), you may be disqualified from an event for any reason, including but not limited to if:
items.rule_violation: You intentionally break any rules in this ruleset
items.equipment_violation: Your equipment does not comply with the equipment regulations
items.launch_errors: You commit an excessive number of launch errors or launch in an unsafe manner
items.misconduct: You behave in a rude, unsportsmanlike, or otherwise disruptive manner
items.match_result: If you are disqualified during a match, you will lose the match. The results of previous rounds will not be modified.
items.prize_forfeit: If you are disqualified from an event, you forfeit any placement and prizing.
items.future_ban: If you are disqualified from an event, you may be suspended or banned from attending future events.

cta.title: Ready to Join the Competition?
cta.description: Now that you've read the rules, come join the Beyblade X competition and have fun at NK Board Game!
